Package de.goldkugel.etl.atom

Class Atom

java.lang.Object
de.goldkugel.etl.atom.Atom
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Atom extends Object implements Serializable
This is a basic class to deal with tabular data in an etl process. Every object of this class represents a cell in a table containing some data. Column headers are stored in "AtomTypes" and should not be converted into objects of this class. Please note, that every combination (type, index) should be unique to ensure further processing. Anyway, this should and is not being tested. If some problems will be encountered because of ignoring this hint it might not be able to be detected easily. Moreover, to save time please ensure to use always the same set of type objects. To deal with any inconvenient, this class can be serialised in a file if some error and / or warnings occur or even for testing.
Author:
Peter Pallaoro

  • Field Details

    • serialVersionUID

      private static final long serialVersionUID
      The serivalVersionUID to serialise the objects of this class.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TYPE

      protected final AtomType TYPE
      The type of the atom. Usually, in a tabular data structure the type is already known while reading. Types can not change over time but one atom can be splitted into more atoms if necessary. This should never be null.

    • content

      protected String content
      The content of an atom can change over time, since sometimes it is necessary to delete content parts for example for data privacy reasons. No history of content is provided.

    • INDEX

      protected final Integer INDEX
      The index of the line the atom belongs to. To avoid any index problems while creating the atoms, the first row should always have the line number zero. This should never be null.

  • Constructor Details

    • Atom

      public Atom(@NonNull AtomType type, @NonNull Integer index)
      Sets the type and the index of the atom. These two parameters can not be changed after initialisation and need to be non-null.
      Parameters:
      type - : the AtomType. Not null.
      index - : the index of the line of the atom.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object atom)
      Checks if this object is equal to a given object. If the given object is not an Atom the return value is false. Only if type, index, and content is equal to each other, the return value is true. The checks are being performed in exactly this order.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      type - : the Atom which equality with this object is being checked.
      Returns:
      true if both objects have the same type, index, and content, false if not.

    • compareTo

      public Integer compareTo(Object atom)
      Compares an object to this. If the given object is an Atom, the first thing that is checked is the index, afterwards the type, and than the content. The value of the first comparison which does not return zero will be returned. The used methods for comparison are AtomType.equals(Object type), Integer.compareTo(Integer), and String.compareTo(String).
      Parameters:
      type - : the other AtomType to compare this one to.
      Returns:
      zero if the given object was not an AtomType. If the given object was an AtomType the return value is the same as atomtype.compareTo(type).
